comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: 2 August 1939 was a Wednesday, one month before WW2 was declared.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
" The massive 150 ton sheer legs ( a type of crane) on Garden Island was a mistake - the result of a cable to England in the 1890s requesting "1 50 ton sheer legs". "
from - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemdetailpaged.aspx?itemid=412354#

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] What a shock they must have had when the crane arrived!

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/mich2009] Yes it is, it's a high-speed battle practice target boat which was radio-controlled (I have aded it to the caption above).

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Sheerlegs were installed in 1893 - see wonderful description in the SMH Tuesday, 11 July 1893 p.5 col.6 (Ministerial Visit) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13917123 . They show up in so many of these old photos - it's good to get a definite date for them. See also investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp...
